bioghist.p: The Pike, Hook, and Gove families are related to the Houston Smith family through the marriage of Charlotte Harding Shepherd (Brown) to Samuel Frederick Houston. Benjamin Brown married Sarah Gove. Their daughter, Lydia Brown, married Moses Pike in 1744. Sarah Pike, their daughter, married Josiah Hooke in 1767. Their son, Captain Moses Hooke married Harriet (Butler) Callender. Their son, Charles Moses Shepherd, Jr, married Josephine Kenner; and their daughter Charlotte Harding Shepherd (Brown) married Samuel Frederick Houston after the death of her first husband, Charles Wardell Brown.

scopecontent.p: The Pike-Hooke-Gove Families Papers contain genealogical notes, deeds, affidavits, and clippings of or regarding the Hooke, Pike, Gove, and Pote families. The collection also includes photographs of paintings and magazines that contain photos of the Hooke family home, and an oversized engraving of the York and Cape Neddick Harbors (1854).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
